defs.name: d2d
defs.docs: Convenience wrappers for Direct2D objects.

/ exact safety guarantees is work in progress).

defs.name: D2DFactory
defs.docs: A Direct2D factory object.

attributes.value: / A Direct2D factory object.
/ This struct is public only to use for system integration in piet_common and druid-shell. It is not intended
/ that end-users directly use this struct.

attributes.value: / A Direct2D device.

defs.name: DeviceContext
defs.docs: The main context that takes drawing operations.

attributes.value: / The main context that takes drawing operations.
/ This type is a thin wrapper for
/ [ID2D1DeviceContext](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d2d1_1/nn-d2d1_1-id2d1devicecontext).
/ This struct is public only to use for system integration in piet_common and druid-shell. It is not intended
/ that end-users directly use this struct.

defs.name: create_bitmap_from_dxgi
defs.value:
pub unsafe fn create_bitmap_from_dxgi(&Self, &ComPtr<IDXGISurface>, f32)
-> Result<Bitmap, Error>
defs.docs: Create a bitmap from a DXGI surface.

attributes.value: / Create a bitmap from a DXGI surface.
/ Most often, this bitmap will be used to set the target of a
/ DeviceContext.
/ Assumes RGBA8 format and premultiplied alpha.
/ The `unsafe` might be conservative, but we assume the `dxgi`
/ argument is in good shape to be a target.
/ # Safety
/ TODO

defs.name: begin_draw
defs.docs: Begin drawing.

attributes.value: / Begin drawing.
/ This must be done before any piet drawing operations.
/ There may be safety concerns (not clear what happens if the sequence
/ is not followed).

defs.name: HitTestPoint
defs.docs: Results from calling `hit_test_point` on a TextLayout.

attributes.value: / Results from calling `hit_test_point` on a TextLayout.

defs.name: metrics
defs.docs:
The output geometry fully enclosing the hit-test location. When is_inside is set to false,
 this structure represents the geometry enclosing the edge closest to the hit-test location.

attributes.value: / The output geometry fully enclosing the hit-test location. When is_inside is set to false,
/ this structure represents the geometry enclosing the edge closest to the hit-test location.

defs.name: is_inside
defs.docs:
An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is inside the text string. When
 false, the position nearest the text's edge is returned.

attributes.value: / An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is inside the text string. When
/ false, the position nearest the text's edge is returned.

defs.name: is_trailing_hit
defs.docs:
An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is at the leading or the
 trailing side of the character. When is_inside is set to false, this value is set according
 to the output hitTestMetrics->textPosition value to represent the edge closest to the
 hit-test location.

attributes.value: / An output flag that indicates whether the hit-test location is at the leading or the
/ trailing side of the character. When is_inside is set to false, this value is set according
/ to the output hitTestMetrics->textPosition value to represent the edge closest to the
/ hit-test location.

defs.name: HitTestMetrics
defs.value: HitTestMetrics { text_position, length, left, top, width, height, bidi_level, is_text, is_trimmed }
defs.docs: Describes the region obtained by a hit test.

attributes.value: repr(C)
/ Describes the region obtained by a hit test.

defs.name: text_position
defs.docs: The first text position within the hit region.

attributes.value: / The first text position within the hit region.

defs.name: length
defs.docs: The number of text positions within the hit region.

defs.name: top

defs.docs: The width of the hit region.

defs.name: height

defs.name: bidi_level
defs.docs: The BIDI level of the text positions within the hit region.

defs.name: is_text
defs.docs: Non-zero if the hit region contains text; otherwise, `0`.
